items.summary: Update the 'Yes' success-state content (the card shown after the celebration overlay) to use the exact user-provided copy, including a new header and two body paragraphs, and enhance the typography/layout to feel like a romantic love note while keeping all user-facing text in English.

Ensure the 'No' path is a persistent loop: the user can keep attempting to choose "No" indefinitely and is repeatedly presented with the option again ("No" is never a terminal outcome). Each attempt should show an escalating sequence of teasing prompts so the user feels 'bombarded' playfully, while still keeping the app responsive and not broken.

Add more animation and cute emotes/design accents throughout the question and success views (e.g., additional heart/sparkle accents, micro-interactions on buttons and headings), while respecting reduced-motion preferences by providing non-motion alternatives (subtle style changes, static accents) when motion is reduced.
